steps.name: Flights (Logistics)
steps.description: Book round-trip business class flights from a major Indian city (e.g., Delhi, Mumbai) to a major Chinese city (e.g., Beijing, Shanghai) with a reputable airline like Air China or China Eastern. Consider direct flights or flights with minimal layovers to optimize travel time. steps.name: Airport Transfers (Logistics)
steps.description: Arrange private airport transfers in both India (departure city) and China (arrival city) using a premium service with a chauffeur-driven car. This ensures a smooth and comfortable transition to and from the airports. Options include black car service and private car rentals. Pre-booking is essential.

steps.name: Accommodation (Hotels)
steps.description: Reserve a luxurious suite at a 5-star hotel in the chosen Chinese city (e.g., The Peninsula Shanghai, Four Seasons Hotel Beijing). Ensure the hotel offers business amenities such as a well-equipped business center, high-speed internet, and executive lounge access. Consider the hotel's proximity to the primary business meeting locations.

steps.name: Visa Processing (Docs)
steps.description: Initiate the Chinese visa application process well in advance. Assist with document preparation, including passport validity checks, visa application forms, invitation letters (if required), and any supporting documents. Explore expedited visa processing options to ensure timely visa acquisition. We will provide a detailed checklist of necessary documents based on the most recent consulate requirements for Indian citizens traveling to China for business.

steps.name: Travel Insurance (Docs)
steps.description: Secure comprehensive travel insurance that covers medical emergencies, trip cancellations, lost luggage, and other unforeseen events. Ensure the insurance policy covers business-related activities and provides adequate coverage for China. The policy will need to include emergency medical evacuation. Confirm the insurance provider is reputable and accessible 24/7.

steps.name: Business Meeting Logistics (Key Activities)
steps.description: Assist with the organization and logistics of business meetings. This includes arranging meeting rooms, presentation equipment, translation services (if required), and catering. Explore potential business networking events or industry conferences relevant to the client's field. Confirm meeting schedules and locations with the client's Chinese counterparts.

steps.name: Cultural Immersion (Key Activities/Optional)
steps.description: Arrange for a private guided tour of culturally significant sites in the Chinese city (e.g., Forbidden City, Great Wall of China). Suggest a traditional Chinese dinner at a renowned restaurant. Offer opportunities to experience local culture and customs respectfully. This portion of the trip is optional but is highly encouraged to foster stronger business relationships.

steps.name: Internal Transportation (Logistics)
steps.description: Book private transportation (car with driver) for all internal travel within the Chinese city to ensure punctuality and comfort for meetings and activities. If appropriate given destination, explore high-speed train options. Ensure any transfers between cities are smooth and efficient.
